jobDescription:
“Can you help us progress from great to outstanding?”

We are on the lookout for talented individuals who can help us answer this question. In an increasingly competitive market, we need to constantly find ways of improving performance. Our Strategic Projects & Business Performance team are currently recruiting for several bright individuals who can join our team as Data Scientists. As a Data Scientist you will think ‘big picture’ and add value to Compass Group by transforming data into valuable insights that will enable us to implement projects that lead to improvements in business performance & productivity.  

Compass Group are 60,000 talented people bringing you all of the great tasting food, memorable experiences and vital support services that can transform every day into a great day and this is a rare and exciting opportunity to play an integral role in the future success of our business.  

Main responsibilities

As a key member of a high profile team backed by the Compass Group UK & Ireland leadership team and led directly by the Director of Strategy & Business Performance; this opportunity enables you to shape the future of our business through your own findings and subsequent project implementation.

Your initial focus will encompass labour productivity, within a project that optimises labour scheduling and spend across our units; although what comes next will be identified and driven by you. As a Data Scientist you will use advanced data analysis & modelling to identify opportunities to improve business performance and productivity.

This is a critical role that will see you design, develop and deploy algorithms through statistical analysis and programming that will support business decision making tools. In addition to this, you will develop reports and dashboards that will assess and quantify the benefits delivered against opportunities identified by projects within the Strategic Projects & Business Performance team. 

Ideal candidate

Do you want to be part of something new and exciting? Do you want the opportunity to shape it? Do you want to utilise your existing skills and learn valuable new ones? Do you want to change things for the better?

If the answer is yes to all these questions, you could be a great fit for this team. You’ll be degree educated with demonstrable success as a Data Scientist ideally working within corporate functions and/or operations projects. You’ll be bright with big aspirations and enthusiastic about seeking out and taking on new challenges.

As an individual, you will be firmly focused on delivery with the ability to lead end to end projects to successful outcomes. You will have proven quantitative and qualitative analytical and modelling skills and thus, the ability to manage large volumes of data. You will be subsequently have demonstrable abilities in creating visualisations to aid in understanding aforementioned data.  More importantly, you will be brave, creative, hard-working and tenacious with unquestionable integrity and a passion for driving change across a complex landscape.

If you think this role is for you and would like to obtain further information regarding salary or role specifics, please contact me at .

Data Scientist (Python, R)

An exciting and fascinating role working at the forefront of scientific software and analysis. This role will combine a deep-dive, R&D approach to data analysis/data science combining advanced mathematics with scientific, computational methods (including the use of technologies Python and R).

Summary:

This role is working with one of the most exciting scientific software companies in the UK- creating the next generation of applications for scientific data analysis, used by companies the world over. This is an opportunity to get involved at an early stage in the company's growth and make a big impact within the R&D and Product Departments of the business. You will be working with some incredibly complex datasets: not just large but also unstructured - combining significant commercial experience of data analysis and/or data science with strong computer programming skills in one or more development or scripting languages (C++, Python, Java etc.). The company are continuously innovating and along with the revolutionary aspect of their end products they are also continually playing with and implementing new technologies from the Big Data and Open Source markets such as MongoDB and Hadoop (however experience of these is not necessary).

Role and Responsibilities:

*Be responsible for data analytics / data science on massive sets of complex and unstructured data
*Help to develop the extraction and analysis techniques using a variety of computing methodologies and languages (e.g. Automation, algorithm development, Python, R)
*Add to the ethos of a vibrant software start-up with innovation, hard-work and a true passion for technology
*Work with complex scientific problems which will impact real-world events, helping to create simple solutions for extremely challenging problems.

Skills Required:

*Advanced skills in mathematics, including applied statistics, data science, data analysis, data modelling, algorithmic development etc.
*Strong skills in symbolic mathematics / technical computing software e.g. R, Matlab, Octave, Accumulo, Mathematica etc.
*Understanding of Software Programming ideally with Python
*Computer Science knowledge (algorithms, distributed systems, low latency, concurrency, graph & string theory, machine learning, big-O notation etc.)
*Ideally have commercial experience of working with extremely large datasets
*An excellent academic track record with a BSc minimum (2.1 or above) in a computing, scientific, mathematical or engineering discipline. MScs and PhDs preferred.
*Strong communication skills

Salary for Data Scientist:

£35,000 - £45,000 + an excellent benefits package

Contact:

Nick Goodwin - Senior Consultant at Reqiva Ltd

reed.co.uk is seeking a Data Scientist to fill a newly created role within our search team to help drive the development and competitive advantage of the UK's #1 job site.

reed.co.uk is created by a dedicated and passionate in-house team, using ASP.NET and C# with SQL Server as the core technologies. We are now rapidly expanding our tooling and platforms to include technologies including Amazon Redshift, Looker, Apache Spark/Hadoop, Docker and Elasticsearch and other open source tools to enable us to better understand, interrogate and utilise our data.

What you’ll do

This new role will help identify patterns and trends in our fantastic data, which represents nearly two decades of the jobs and careers market. Changing jobs can represent one of the most important decisions of someone’s life and the data captures millions of these amazing transactions every year. As an idea of the scale, every month, we have more than 7 million unique users, 16 million visits, 4.5 million job applications and 200k jobs added and these numbers are continuing to grow.

In particular you will be specialising in the search side of our business, helping to improve the relevance our search results. You will be using a variety of technologies, tools and techniques including Apache Spark or other distributed computing frameworks, Google Analytics and BigQuery

  • Defining and exploring what search relevance looks like

  • Analysing what makes a good match between job advertisements and jobseekers
  • Understanding and exploring search traffic, customer journeys, customer feedback to ensure the right content is surfaced at the right time, within the right context
  • Designing and running experiments to validate hypotheses which may involve building learning models, tweaking search analysers or extending our existing models or tools

About you

This role will suit candidates from eclectic backgrounds as we are primarily seeking an analytical and inquisitive mind. A passion for data is more important than specific technical skills as you will be working with experienced and deeply technical colleagues. Any experience of working within a scrum team would also be useful. This role is an excellent opportunity for a candidate seeking the opportunity to drive themselves with their own enthusiasm for the subject matter.

You will need

  • A solid background in statistics and computer science

  • Knowledge and experience working with and manipulating textual data
  • To have worked with machine learning models applied to textual data
  • Familiarity of search technologies (Elasticsearch/Solr/Lucene)
  • Proficient working with relational and non-relational data sources
  • Fluency of Python, and common machine learning packages i.e scikit-learn
  • Experience of experiment design
  • To be a self-starter, bringing your own creativity, enthusiasm and real world problem-solving to a highly motivated team

You will be rewarded with

  • The opportunity to quickly make an impact on an already successful team
  • Passionate colleagues who excel in their individual disciplines
  • Exposure to the latest new technologies and with the ability to bring more of your own favourites
  • A fantastic working environment, with colleagues that care about the quality and success of their work
  • Up to 10% of your time to work on something other than your day job or to concentrate on your own personal development
  • Fantastic development opportunities with a structured career path and tailored talent plans
  • Flexible work hours and holidays
  • Our Love Mondays campaign - pizza Mondays, massages, yoga etc
  • Ongoing social events throughout the year

Other benefits include childcare vouchers, a company pension scheme, personal accident cover, a personal development allowance and free eye tests.

So if you want to work for the UK’s biggest recruitment brand and you’re ready to Love Mondays, get in touch today.

About The Job

About the Tesco Data Science Team

The Data Science Team sits centrally within Tesco and focuses on solving complex business problems and developing data products that can be deployed at scale to our customers. Our work spans across multiple areas including physical stores, online, fulfilment, marketing and Clubcard and we encourage rotation amongst our Data Scientists so they can apply their skills to different business challenges and gain deeper levels of subject matter expertise. The Data Science Team is made up of multi-disciplined researchers and practitioners with varied backgrounds from both academia and the business world. We strive to foster a culture of innovation by encouraging our Data Scientists to focus 20% of their time on self-driven projects that utilise their expertise to solve real-world challenges that Tesco faces.

Our core work involves:

  • Developing data products that can be deployed at scale both internally and externally
  • Supporting the automation of decision making across the business
  • Optimising processes for key business objectives
  • Conducting deep dive exploratory analysis to inform strategic decision making

Examples of our previous work include:

  • Building search and recommender Systems for our web portfolio
  • Optimising space and range within our stores
  • Optimising delivery routes for our vans
  • Developing enhanced picking algorithms for our fulfilment centres
  • Optimising online prices
  • Developing measures of long term customer value

Main Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist, you will have the following responsibilities:

  • Solve Data Science problems and participate in the majority of the project lifecycle with minimal support from senior team members
  • Understand difficult business problems and prototype solutions
  • Analyse and link complex datasets so that they may be learned from or optimised
  • Build mathematical models on top of big data architectures to gain deep insights into opportunities to improve the customer experience and the Tesco business
  • Communicate complex solutions in a clear, understandable way to non-experts
  • Promote data science across Tesco, and promote Tesco across the external Data Science community

Ideal Candidate

You are a Data Scientist with a strong knowledge of the Data Science Toolkit (Maths & Stats, Programming, Machine Learning, Communication & Visualisation etc) who evangelises Data Science. You therefore tick the majority of the following points:

Mathematical & Statistical Understanding:

  • A strong numerical higher degree in a mathematical, scientific, engineering or computer science discipline with application to Data Science
  • The ability to use your academic knowledge and commercial experience to tackle specific business problems
  • An analytical mind set and the ability to use your academic knowledge to tackle specific business problems

Programming Experience:

  • Experience with different programming languages and a good grasp of at least one language - Python, Java, Scala, R (or similar)
  • Experience working with open source Data Science environments
  • Knowledge of open source big-data technology such as Apache Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, Pig, MapReduce

Commercial Experience:

What is the plan for the Data Scientist role?

The key focus is to identify opportunities for predictive analytics and optimization across the business, present ideas, propose analytics / solution approach, gather, explore, cleanse, integrate and analyse data from large operational transactional datasets and external online sources, conduct statistical data exploration and quantitative analysis, assess data quality, share and verify key findings with business, apply supervised and non-supervised machine learning algorithms, fine tune models, test and validate models, build optimisation engines, assess key model characteristics and overall impact, re-iterate certain phases of the process if necessary, assist to implement solution into production environment, educate business stakeholders on model output, impact and behaviour, assist / coach along the business process transformation lifecycle.

What will you do as a Data Scientist?

• Define, build and verify machine learning solutions, optimization engines and statistical models to maximize business value in Acquisition, Product management, CRM, Trading, Responsible Gambling, Finance and VIP management
• Use supervised machine learning approaches to exploit predictive value from large internal transactional datasets and external data sources
• Apply non-supervised machine learning approaches, advanced statistical and analytical
• Understand how advanced analytic technique and application, such as decision trees and clustering techniques can help to solve business problems
• Enhance overall customer behavioural profile and improve organizational capability for optimized next best action
• Chose the best modelling approach for given business problem
• Identify target variable, define need for input data
• Conduct data preparation to integrate data from heterogeneous sources and prepare data ready for modelling / analysis
• Apply multivariate analysis to understand variables predictive power
• Use advanced data manipulation and creativity to invent new features that boost model performance
• Apply clustering algorithms to enhance customer behavioural segmentation
• Fine-tune model performance for best business benefit
• Compile an analytical plan for given business problem
• Define hypothesis/null hypotheses to be tested
• Monitor live model performance, apply statistical process control approaches to identify significant performance deviation and need for intervention / model refresh
• Develop algorithms that personalize content or automate actions at various customer touch points
• Build custom solutions around real-time event streams and stream analytics
• Exploit opportunities around Big Data technologies and cloud processing
• Interact with business stakeholders to identify key opportunities for predictive analytics and optimization
• Gain agreement and support for analytical approaches and solutions amongst business stakeholders
• Articulate model characteristics and impact to business stakeholders efficiently, with less emphasis on technical details and more focus on commercial implications
• Educate business users and leaders on how to interpret and use model output
• Drive analytical projects through to delivery and embed them within the organisation, advocate predictive analytics to transform operational business processes
• Identify potential new external data sources that can enhance data, assess value, build prototype data feeds / data collection processes and conduct proof of concept for data usability

What do you know that makes you a great Data Scientist?

• BSC in computer science, mathematics or statistics
• Experience of data analytics at a senior level
• A true talent in working with data
• Experience with modelling platforms R, Python, Knime, Statistica, SAS Miner or Stat, XLStat
• A balanced set of expertise across a number of domains including supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques, data engineering, statistical analysis, custom tools development and business consulting.
• Strong understanding of the data mining methodology i.e. Crisp DM, SEMMA
• Experience in building models of decision trees, neural networks, random forests, logistic and linear regression, text mining, clustering, ensemble models, uplift modelling
• Methods for Validating Models: mean squared error, R squared, Confusion matrix, gains, ROC
• Expert data manipulation skills SQL, analytical functions, query optimization, Python automation
• Experience in Big Data environments (MS Azure, Spark, Hive) and/or stream analytics
• Good understanding of business processes within online gaming
• Strong understanding and experience working with large transactional data sets, e.g. bet records, site visitor data, transformation and analytics conducted over billions of records
• Strong application of descriptive analytics and statistical techniques
• Strong presentation skills, able to simplify and articulate complex domain areas to senior stakeholders.

jobTitle: Data Scientist  Using statistical & data expertise to produce real time actionable insights
jobDescription:
About Us

Oakbrook Finance is part of the Blenheim Chalcot Group a business builder with combined sales in excess of £350m, £500m of assets under management.

The financial services industry is undergoing a seismic shift and the collection of customer data has grown exponentially in the recent years. Understanding customer’s behaviour and their requirements at every step of their journey has become hugely important now.

Oakbrook Finance is at the heart of this, seeking to use this information to provide better borrowing options for people not well served by traditional lenders. We use data, statistics and machine learning to drive innovation in marketing, underwriting and customer service.

Data scientists at Oakbrook Finance bring together all of the scattered customer data from every journey and interaction into real time actionable insights.

Role overview

Solving data problems at Oakbrook finance is about collecting and structuring good data, leveraging quantitative analysis, machine learning, statistical learning, mathematical modelling, and some analytic creativity to gain purchase on solving important problems.

You should be intellectually curious and have strong ability to structure the problem, drive appropriate analysis and make clear actionable recommendations

An exciting time to join, responsibilities will include

  • Working closely with credit, product, marketing and software engineering teams to identify develop and deliver data driven solutions.

Position:             Lead Safety Data Scientist

Location:            Cambridge, UK; Gothenburg, Sweden; or Boston, USA

Salary:                Competitive & Excellent Benefits Package

At AstraZeneca we turn ideas into life changing medicines. Working here means being entrepreneurial, thinking big and working together to make the impossible a reality. We’re inspired by the things that seem impossible. Here, we see the impact of our collective ideas and expertise, and the power of science to deliver them.

We believe in the potential of our people and you’ll develop beyond what you thought possible. We make the most of your skills and passion by actively supporting you in order to ensure you achieve your potential. You’ll join an energized team and work on projects that offer a wide range of on-going learning and career development opportunities.

At the forefront of scientific innovation, AZ is embracing the value of data analytics, big data and data science, as key levers of insight and productivity. We are currently seeking a Lead Safety Data Scientist within the Predictive Compound ADME and Safety Group, a division of our Drug Safety and Metabolism (DSM) unit at AstraZeneca. 

In this role you’ll have the opportunity to build an industry leading capability, leading a team of data scientists to create and implement strategies for the capture, integration and exploitation of large-scale data sets across the preclinical and clinical safety domains.  Through the use of the latest advances in data science, analytics and artificial intelligence, you will aid in the identification of novel drug candidates with the best risk profiles ultimately leading to safer medicines for our patients.  The data science team will focus on taking a ’Systems Biology’ approach to ‘Big Data’ to research and further our understanding of preclinical to clinical translation as well as the chemical and biological mechanisms of adverse events connecting into initiatives such as our “2 million genomes” previously announced.

You’ll use your computational skills for hypothesis generation, providing decision support to projects and to explain complex relationships within large scale data sets. Your ability to bridge the understanding of models and modelling across diverse disciplines is key. Join AZ for an exciting, challenging and rewarding career in data science.  Join us on the journey to better health outcomes for patients, driven by data intensive science and decision making.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Drive the strategy and lead a team of data scientists for the analysis and mining of large data sets (Big Data)
  • Work collaboratively with other data analytics groups and key stakeholders across AstraZeneca
  • Provide state-of-the-art data management and computational services to allow effective use of models by the business
  • Drive the research, development and application of predictive models and tools, including artificial intelligence and Deep Learning approaches, appropriate for the different phases of drug discovery and development
  • Contribute to departmental strategies for data management and data structures to better enable modelling and informatics
  • Work closely with DSM scientists providing computational support, technical expertise and input to influence scientific, project and departmental decisions.
  • Train and mentor iMED scientists in the use of models to aid projects progression and decision making

Qualifications, Skills and Experience

Required:

  • MSc or PhD in a life science, computational biology, data science, informatics, statistics or other relevant field, with track record of impactful publications
  • Track record of leading impactful delivery in data science projects and successful manager of people in a life science organization
  • Experience with and knowledge of advanced machine learning and data mining technologies with applications in one of the following areas: predictive and statistical modeling, machine learning and text mining (e.g. R, scikit learn, Mahout, openCV etc)
  • Demonstrated computational skills in a rapid prototyping platform (Python/Julia/Matlab etc)
  • Experience of end-to-end software tool/solution development and lifecycle management
  • Overview knowledge of computer hardware & software, including: databases, programming & scripting languages, hardware & software architecture, OTS tools (e.g. for data analysis & visualisation)

Desirable:

  • Knowledge of software development in one or more high level language (e.g. C++)
  • Experience with or knowledge of computational biology and bioinformatics
